div.a: Why One Newspaper Is Backing Away From Facebook

div.div: The Guardian was one of the first publications to release an auto-posting “social reader” for Facebook. Now, the site is taking back control of its content.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z3JjpN&via=Digg&text=Why One Newspaper Is Backing Away From Facebook

div.a: How To Stop A Suicide Attempt On The Golden Gate Bridge

div.div: About 1,500 people have committed suicide by jumping off the Golden Gate Bridge during its 75-year-history. It's a tragic number, but it would have been much higher if not for Kevin Briggs and other members of the California Highway Patrol.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UD3RMY&via=Digg&text=How To Stop A Suicide Attempt On The Golden Gate Bridge

div.a: 12 Weird Things You Might Not Know About World Of Warcraft

div.div: A lot of weird things have happened in Azeroth (the game’s world) and on Earth (our world) as a result of the game’s enduring popularity. Here are a few of them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZdFY6j&via=Digg&text=12 Weird Things You Might Not Know About World Of Warcraft

div.a: What Makes A Yacht A Yacht?

div.div: And when did owning one become a symbol of wealth?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZjGTSL&via=Digg&text=What Makes A Yacht A Yacht?

div.a: How The Mafia Is Ruining Naples's Food Scene

div.div: Once known as "Campania Felix" for its fertile land and "happy" farmers, the area acquired a more macabre nickname, "the triangle of death."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VCZyCy&via=Digg&text=How The Mafia Is Ruining Naples's Food Scene

div.div: The tech industry and its press have treated the rise of billion-scale social networks and ubiquitous smartphone apps as an unadulterated win for regular people, a triumph of usability and empowerment. They seldom talk about what we've lost along the way in this transition, and I find that younger folks may not even know how the web used to be.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ud81Na&via=Digg&text=The Web We Lost

div.a: The History Of U.S. Income Taxes In One GIF

div.div: The 1040 has been the primary American tax form since the introduction of the personal income tax in 1913. That’s even been the form’s name since the very beginning. But what started as a simple document with 27 lines of information to fill out has grown ever more complex: the current 1040 has 77 line items—plus a 189-page appendix of instructions. Watch as it evolves.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UnZ8zR&via=Digg&text=The History Of U.S. Income Taxes In One GIF

div.div: THE VIRUSES MADE HIM DO IT

div.a: McAfee Admits To Playing The 'Crazy Card'

div.div: The security software founder, who has arrived back in the U.S. after fleeing Belize for Guatemala, tells ABC News he faked an illness to avoid being deported to Belize.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VCKjto&via=Digg&text=McAfee Admits To Playing The 'Crazy Card'

div.div: SHIA LABEOUF MUST BE BEHIND THIS

div.a: UChicago Admissions Receives Mysterious Package Addressed To Indiana Jones

div.div: "Yesterday we received a package addressed to 'Henry Walton Jones, Jr.'... Little did we know what we were looking at. When our student mail worker snapped out of his finals-tired haze and realized who Dr. Jones was, we were sort of in luck: this package wasn’t meant for a random professor..."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XfPi4c&via=Digg&text=UChicago Admissions Receives Mysterious Package Addressed To Indiana Jones

div.a: Portraits Of People Who Look Alike But Aren't Related At All

div.div: Canadian photographer François Brunelle is fascinated with the human face and the question of whether everyone has a doppelganger somewhere on Earth that looks exactly like them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SVoqIf&via=Digg&text=Portraits Of People Who Look Alike But Aren't Related At All

div.a: U.S. Terror Agency Can Now Read Your Government Files Without Cause

div.div: Rules now allow the little-known National Counterterrorism Center to examine the government files of U.S. citizens for possible criminal behavior, even if there is no reason to suspect them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UE59JP&via=Digg&text=U.S. Terror Agency Can Now Read Your Government Files Without Cause

div.a: Cops Take Down Major Brooklyn Gang Using Social Media

div.div: The cops were able to infiltrate and bust the gang after a year-long investigation using social media; creating “fake” profiles and friending the gang members. Especially young gang members couldn’t help but brag about their “accomplishments” such as mayhem and murder on Twitter and Facebook.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Zi4p2m&via=Digg&text=Cops Take Down Major Brooklyn Gang Using Social Media

div.a: How To Redeem 'Baby, It's Cold Outside'

div.div: Earlier this week, Stephen Deusner at Salon wrote an article pointing out a troubling truth about the beloved holiday carol "Baby, It's Cold Outside": If you listen to the words, it sounds like the song is describing the run-up to a sexual assault. So what can be done to fix a classic?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UeoUqa&via=Digg&text=How To Redeem 'Baby, It's Cold Outside'

div.a: Watch Google Maps Absolutely Destroy Apple Maps

div.div: Google Maps for iOS is so much better than Apple's attempt at a replacement that it will make you giggle.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TdfU5X&via=Digg&text=Watch Google Maps Absolutely Destroy Apple Maps

div.div: The rare offer for G-men branded gear is good for four hours only. Intelligence locates the store somewhere between the 22nd and 29th floor of 26 Federal Plaza. Special clearance required.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SUuBuT&via=Digg&text=FBI To Hold Top-Secret Sale

div.a: Did The CW Just Create A Real Life 'Hunger Games'?

div.div: The CW just ordered The Hunt, a show that aims to adapt The Hunger Games by basically making its reality show conceit an actual reality

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tafr4v&via=Digg&text=Did The CW Just Create A Real Life 'Hunger Games'?

div.a: TLC Plans 'Best Funeral Ever' Reality Show

div.div: TLC is ready to put the “fun” back into funeral. The network has ordered a special/backdoor pilot, Best Funeral Ever, that goes behind-the-scenes of a unconventional funeral parlor.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UE4CYu&via=Digg&text=TLC Plans 'Best Funeral Ever' Reality Show

div.a: NASA's Lunar Orbiters Preparing To Crash Into Moon

div.div: Running low on fuel and with a successful moon-mapping mission behind them, NASA’s twin GRAIL probes will leave lunar orbit and crash into the moon on Dec. 17.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UddcN3&via=Digg&text=NASA's Lunar Orbiters Preparing To Crash Into Moon

div.div: CATCH MORE COMMITTEE CHAIRS WITH HONEY

Some congressmen are gaining martyr status among conservative activists after they were “purged” from House committees for what they say is a matter of sticking to their principles on tough votes. But some of their colleagues say the trio got yanked by the leadership-driven Republican Steering Committee because they’re jerks — or worse.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TX9udx&via=Digg&text='The A--Hole Factor'

div.a: N. Joseph Woodland, Inventor Of The Bar Code, Dies At 91

div.div: Had Mr. Woodland not been a Boy Scout, had he not logged hours on the beach and had his father not been quite so afraid of organized crime, the code would very likely not have been invented in the form it was, if at all.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TWAYQo&via=Digg&text=N. Joseph Woodland, Inventor Of The Bar Code, Dies At 91

div.div: BEER IS A PERFORMANCE ENHANCING DRUG

div.a: Behind The Scenes At The World Darts Championships

div.div: Over the public address system, “The Imperial March” — Darth Vader’s theme — played at ear-shattering volume. The fans, many dressed as Mr. Incredible, pirates, animals or the Jamaican bobsledders from the film “Cool Runnings,” had scrawled messages on placards, hoping the television cameras would spot them. This is the scene at the World Darts Championships.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z3AEn2&via=Digg&text=Behind The Scenes At The World Darts Championships

div.a: Why Illegal Drugs Cost So Much

div.div: What are you paying for when you purchase illegal drugs?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UVK3c4&via=Digg&text=Why Illegal Drugs Cost So Much

div.a: What It Looks Like To Be Air Bombed

div.div: A stark reminder of what it's like to live in one of the most dangerous places on the planet right now.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QWYuML&via=Digg&text=What It Looks Like To Be Air Bombed

div.a: 7 Secret Ways America's Stealth Armada Stays Off The Radar

div.div: Here are 7 methods America uses to keep up the best stealth fleet in the world.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TX1OYV&via=Digg&text=7 Secret Ways America's Stealth Armada Stays Off The Radar

div.a: NASA Admits They Misidentified Mt. Everest

div.div: The world's highest mountain should not be hard to spot but American space agency NASA has admitted it mistook a summit in India for Mount Everest, which straddles the border of Nepal and China.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZlwK7Y&via=Digg&text=NASA Admits They Misidentified Mt. Everest

div.div: IF IT'S BLURRY, YOU HAVE A CONCUSSION

Concussion Watch is an effort to monitor the NFL’s response to the persistent risk of head injury in professional football. To do so, FRONTLINE has partnered with ESPN to track which players are being removed from games after a hit to the head — and which players are not — and to keep score of how long they are kept from the field following a concussion.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12ayKQu&via=Digg&text=The Interactive NFL Concussion Tracker

div.a: Can Facebook Make You Fat And Poor?

div.div: You may want to think twice after posting a new photo or update to your Facebook profile. That’s because new researchhas found that social media use can lower some users' sense of self-control over their lives.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sc5GWK&via=Digg&text=Can Facebook Make You Fat And Poor?

div.a: Is This The Plot To The 'Justice League' Movie?

div.div: According to sources, hot screenwriter Will Beale who got the writing gig for 2015′s Justice League movie is getting his inspiration from a specific series of comics.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QX2jS6&via=Digg&text=Is This The Plot To The 'Justice League' Movie?

div.a: Newspapers Tells Two Reporters To Decide Which One Gets Laid Off

div.div: The Kansas City Star has told reporters Karen Dillon and Dawn Bormann that one of them has to leave the paper, and they — not management — have to decide who goes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TPm8Yw&via=Digg&text=Newspapers Tells Two Reporters To Decide Which One Gets Laid Off

div.div: THEY HAD A LOT OF... PERSONALITY

div.a: 9 Things I'll Miss About Apple Maps

div.div: Did you hear? Google Maps is back in the App Store, which means we can finally officially pretend that whole Apple Maps disaster never happened. Still, there are a few things I'm going to miss about Apple Maps.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ShSAHA&via=Digg&text=9 Things I'll Miss About Apple Maps

div.a: Google Adorably Celebrates Google Maps' Entry To iOS On Twitter

div.div: YouTube, Google Earth and Gmail welcomed Google Maps on Twitter.
